publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in Qizil Miŋ-Öyduring T III MQ 70.2

seg.seg: Diese Welt, die des in einem guten Freunde bestehenden Wassers [und sodann der Tugenden ermangelt, trocknet aus, und die Sonne der falschen Ansichten verbrennt sie.
This world, which lacks the water consisting of [in?] a good friend and furthermore [lacks] the virtues, dries up, and the sun of wrong ideas burns it.
With him who is lacking the garment of a good friend and who is wrapped (?) in the feathers of shamelessness and imprudence, ...
If miserable … without feathers [the young bird] rises from its nest and falls down on earth, then it misses wiñcaññe120 because of pride. Like the mind … (cf 601)
... without feathers [the young bird] rises from its nest and falls down on earth, then it misses wiñcaññe because of pride. Like the mind ...

Likewise, someone who sees the purity of his mind, but not having trained his wisdom leaves the [right] way and puts his trust in love and the … (of) compassion—having deceived his own mind he misses the object.

... wer [zwar] die Reinheit des eigenen Denkens sieht, [aber], [weil] er den Verstand nicht geläutert [hat], von der rechten Weise abgeht [und] [nur] auf Liebe [und] Mitleid vertraut [wtl. vertrauensvoll macht] ..., (der) ... verfehlt das Ziel.

... who[ever] sees the purity of [his] own thinking, [but], [since] he [has] not cleansed the mind, turns away from the [right] manner [and] [only] trusts in love [and] compassion [lit. makes trusting] ..., (he) ... misses [his] destination.
If because of this the good beings …, and they cause to do good to the other without wisdom and with a faitful mind they put their trust [in] the good, then afterwards, (however, they repent it).

list.item: a1 /// ṣṣeṃ ly_k_ats kekalypo_ṣ _ṣ_a_p naumy= ai_ś_amñeṣṣe _p_alskomeṃ āratsi 10-7 krent wāṣmontsā meṅkitse śaiṣṣe se kleś(a)nm(a) – a2 /// [n]e • wase yoktsi yaskast_r_a cmelaṣṣe añmālaṣle ertsi ye_s_añ aikne ste 10-8 krent wāṣmoṣṣe war ot krentaunāsā a3 /// sot_r_a śaiṣṣe se aṅkain pilkoṣṣe kaun _p_a_l_k_ṣ_anme _ṣ_p_a ket no tesā añmālaṣle mā tākoy\ 10-9 saṃ a4 /// śaiṣṣe se kleśanmaṣṣai wämyu _r_askre kāswasā : aṅkain placsa sewīt_r_a atkwal _ṣ_p_a • pelaikneṣṣe sāṃtk= ai a5 /// (20) krent wāṣmoṣṣe wassisā meṅkīce snai yase kwīpets parwāne auloṣsā : _p_a_p_a were triko_ṣ\ kleśa a6 /// lle añmālaṣle śaiṣṣesā 20-1 || strivighā – || ślek śarsa hetubālike ṣañ\ palsko lalaita_ṣ\ neneko[_ṣ_p_a] tne a7 /// auntsate cpik wäntrentse ṣarm (r)ītatsi aknātsaññentse t[_r_a]ṅko kal(p)a ṣañ (añ_m\) 1 t· l· – b1 /// [sn](ai) parwā lestaimeṃ tsāṅkaṃ su kl· y· n· k· tsa wiñcaññe śa(r)w[a](r)ñ(e)sa tr(i)_k_ṣ_a(ṃ) _m_a[k]t(e) [pa]lsk· – – b2 /// 2 mant ra k_use ṣañ\ _p_alskontse lkāṃt_r_a astarññe aiśamñe mā yairu _l_aṃ yäkneme[ṃ] s_p_antai yā_m_aṃ taṅw= āñmala[_ṣ]_ṣ_a b3 /// palsko ṣañ\ tsetserñu tri_k_ṣ_aṃ wäntre 3 mentsiṣṣe samud_t_arne plu_ṣ_aṃ ram no _l_akleṣṣe yerpene ṣe_k\ spo b4 /// aiśt_r_a : mātā_r_a srukalyñeṣṣe koyn kakāyau tekiṣṣeṃ kemeṃtsa po tre_ṣ_ṣ_aṃ śaiṣṣe te ṣarmtsa kreñc ono b5 /// [e]_r_ant_r_a alyekepi kartse yāmtsi snai aiśamñe • takarṣkeṃ palskosa kren_t\ spantai yāmaṃ postanmeṃ b6 /// skent_r_a 5 tumeṃ kalpāskenne rsercci śāmna nakanma t_s_art_s_akwa waṣe wentsi wäntre klaṅktsi • k_use cets mā cäñcre b7 /// cpi mameñat parṣki lkāskeṃ _p_arnāmeṃ ka 6 te ṣarmtsa lita su hetubālike bhavāgg_r_a pos_t_añ[ñ]e yai

a5 With him who is lacking the garment of a good friend and who is wrapped (?) in the feathers of shamelessness and imprudence, ... a7 If miserable b1 ... without feathers [the young bird] rises from its nest and falls down on earth, then it misses wiñcaññe because of pride. Like the mind ...

a1 #M10_11_10_11# %4 /// ṣṣeṃ ; lykäts kekalypoṣ ṣäp #17c naumy= aiśämñeṣṣe ; pälskomeṃ āratsi 17 #17d krent wāṣmontsā ; meṅkitse śaiṣṣe se #18a kleś(a)nm(a) – a2 %6 /// ne • #18b wase yoktsi ; yaskasträ cmelaṣṣe #18c añmālaṣle ; ertsi yesäñ ; aikne ste 18 #18d krent wāṣmoṣṣe war ; ot krentaunāsā #19a a3 %6 /// soträ ; śaiṣṣe se #19b aṅkain pilkoṣṣe ; kaun pälkṣänme ṣpä #19c ket no tesā ; añmālaṣle ; mā tākoy 19 #19d saṃ a4 %6 /// śaiṣṣe se #20a kleśanmaṣṣai ; wämyu räskre ; kāswasā : #20b aṅkain placsa ; sewīträ atkwal ṣpä • #20c pelaikneṣṣe ; sāṃtk= ai a5 %5 /// (20) #20d krent wāṣmoṣṣe ; wassisā meṅkīce #21a snai yase kwīpets ; parwāne auloṣsā : #21b päpä were ; trikoṣ kleśa a6 %2 #21c %3 /// lle ; añmālaṣle ; śaiṣṣesā 21 #21d || strivighā – || #M11_14_11_11# ślek śarsa he,tubāli;ke ṣañ palsko #1a lalaitaṣ nenekoṣ;pä tne a7 %6 #1b /// auntsate cpik , wäntrentse ; ṣarm (r)ītatsi #1c aknātsaññen,tse träṅko ; kal(p)a ṣañ (añm) 1 #1d t· l· – b1 %7 /// sn(ai) paruwa|parwā #2a lestaimeṃ tsāṅkaṃ su ; kl· ; y· n· k· , tsa wiñcaññe #2b śa(r)wa(r)ñ(e)sa , tr(i)kṣä(ṃ) mäk;t(e) palsk· – #2c – b2 %10 /// 2 #2d mant ra k_use ṣañ , pälskontse ; lkāṃträ astaräññe|astarññe #3a aiśamñe mā yairu ; läṃ yäknemeṃ , späntai yāmäṃ #3b taṅw= añmalāṣṣälñe|āñmalaṣ;ṣä|(lñe) b3 %8 /// #3c (su) palsko ṣañ , tsetserñu ; trikṣäṃ wäntre 3 #3d mentsiṣṣe sa,mudtärne ; pluṣäṃ ram no #4a läkleṣṣe yerpene ; ṣek spo b4 %4 /// aiśträ : #4b mātārä sru,kalyñeṣṣe ; koyn kakāyau #4c tekiṣṣeṃ ke,meṃtsa po ; treṣṣäṃ śaiṣṣe #4d te ṣarmtsa kreñc , ono b5 %6 #5a /// eränträ alyekepi ; kartse yāmtsi , snai aiśamñe • #5b takarṣkeṃ pals,kosa krent ; spantai yāmaṃ #5c postanmeṃ b6 %6 /// skenträ 5 #5d tumeṃ kalpās,kenne ; rsercci śāmna #6a nakanma tsärtsäkwa ; waṣe wentsi , wäntare|wäntre klaṅktsi • #6b k_use cets mā cäñcäre|cäñ,cre b7 %5 /// cwi|cpi #6c mameñat par,ṣki lkāskeṃ ; pärnāmeṃ ka 6 #6d te ṣarmtsa li,ta su he;tubālike #7a bhavāggär|bhavāggrä postäññe ; yai %7 #7b

Alternative classifications:
Peyrotarchaic I
Malzahn–
TamaiII-2 (700-800)
Tamai-C14–

Translations from [[Peyrot, ToSu]]
Lines Translation Pages
a7-b1 If miserable … without feathers [the young bird] rises from its nest and falls down on earth, then it misses wiñcaññe120 because of pride. Like the mind … (cf [[Adams, DoT]]: 601) 676
b2-3 Likewise, someone who sees the purity of his mind, but not having trained his wisdom leaves the [right] way and puts his trust in love and the … (of) compassion—having deceived his own mind he misses the object. 676
b4-6 If because of this the good beings …, and they cause to do good to the other without wisdom and with a faitful mind they put their trust [in] the good, then afterwards, (however, they repent it). 677

Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
a2-3 Diese Welt, die des in einem guten Freunde bestehenden Wassers [und sodann der Tugenden ermangelt, trocknet aus, und die Sonne der falschen Ansichten verbrennt sie. 101
b2-3 ... wer [zwar] die Reinheit des eigenen Denkens sieht, [aber], [weil] er den Verstand nicht geläutert [hat], von der rechten Weise abgeht [und] [nur] auf Liebe [und] Mitleid vertraut [wtl. vertrauensvoll macht] ..., (der) ... verfehlt das Ziel. 346

Translation: a6 "Instantly Hetubālika knew [that] his mind had fallen down and perished." ([[Peyrot 2013a]]: 217, citing [[Saito 2006]]: 476) –Martin (Mon, 2015-08-03, 19:28:06 (CEST))

additional classification A1

div.p:
Alternative classifications:

Translation: "Instantly Hetubālika knew [that] his mind had fallen down and perished." (<citedRange>217</citedRange></bibl>, citing <bibl><title corresp="ref:saito2006"/><citedRange>476</citedRange></bibl>) –Martin (Mon, 2015-08-03, 19:28:06 (CEST)) <p>additional classification <peyrot>A1</peyrot> </p></project_comment>
